content:
In normal mode, disable hardware acceleration in Settings/General, then restart TB in normal mode. Is the display correct?

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode
creator: sfhowes

content: No. No change.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

content: As you can see from the kb link, safe mode mainly disables add-ons, hardware acceleration, themes, and applies the default layout ('reset toolbars & controls'). If you work through those options, you should be able to uncover the source of the problem.
creator: sfhowes

content: As I said, without checking the disable and reset options and just continuing to start in Troubleshooting Mode is sufficient to get the emails to display correctly. In any case, I uninstalled my add-ons and went to the default theme but still no luck.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

content: At the safe mode prompt, 'reset toolbars & controls', 'make changes & restart'.
creator: sfhowes

content: Ah yes sorry: I think I was doing it wrong by checking the disable and reset boxes but then clicking on Continue in Troubleshoot Mode rather than Make Changes and Restart. Nonetheless, I got it right now but this has not fixed the problem: only Continuing to Troubleshoot Mode gets the emails to display properly.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

content:
Just to clarify:

disabling hardware acceleration in normal mode has no effect

there are no add-ons, or disabling them has no effect

using the default theme has no effect

resetting toolbars and controls has no effect

you have no userChrome.css in the chrome subfolder of the profile

Perhaps test with a new profile with one account: Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles. The current profile is unaffected.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks very much for your help. You are right about all that except the ccs file. I cant seem to find it anywhere on my PC let alone in the Thunderbird profile folders. I have already tried setting up a new profile but that didnt work either. I have even tried Betterbird but there is the same problem with the same emails.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

content:
A userChrome file has to be applied manually by the user, so you would know if there is one.

If this happens only with some messages, and only with Original HTML, I would look at the message source (Ctrl+U) for anything unique in the composition or user agent.
creator: sfhowes

content: I used to know basic dhtml but that was a long time ago, and I wouldn't know what to look for in this case. For what it's worth, the text which is not visible in one of the offending emails is coded as color: #202020, but appears to show as white on a white background, and hence disappears. That's all I can see.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

content:
Maybe consider adjusting the Colors settings in Settings/General/Language & Appearance (see picture).

Look at the message source and see if there is any html code that looks like it was created in a word processor or some non-email app.
creator: sfhowes

My calendar in Thunderbird shows "Decoration Day (AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA)." As of a few minutes ago, the entry for 2024 in the ICS file on the TB calendar page (linked in my OP) is shown below. If your TB calendar shows "Memorial Day," then either my TB is misreading the file or your calendar is an older version that is correct.

content:
Ciao, anzitutto rientri nei casi in cui TIM autorizza l'accesso tramite client?

Ti ricordiamo che, se la tua TIM Mail non è associata ad una linea ADSL/Fibra di TIM o ad un telefonino TIM, puoi consultare la tua casella @alice.it o @tim.it da client di posta coi protocolli POP3/IMAP solo ed esclusivamente se accedi ad Internet da reti di accesso TIM.

https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/client-pc
creator: @next

content:
Fino a ieri gestivo le mail tramite Thunderbird tranquillamente. Protocollo IMAP sia da Pc che tramite web.

Ho 3 account mail TIM: 2 con estensione @alice.it 1 con estensione @tim.it

Con "@tim.it" autentificazione RIUSCITA OK ! Con "@alice.it" autentificazione NO

AGGIORNAMENTO nel caso possa servire ad altre persone !

Server di posta in uscita SMTP: out.alice.it

OK !!!

content:
Just realized that the version that works on the other PC is Thunderbird 112, can the problems i see be related to version 115?

Is it possible to roll back from 115 to 112?
creator: tomme2

content: I have exactly the same problem - also want to kn ow if I can roll back to 112 as my mail in and out worked fine then.
creator: dmplasteringspec

content:
I think the other PC is running 102, the release before 115 (112 was a beta version).

It's not recommended to downgrade from 115. Be sure to test all the options mentioned in the other topic, including hardware acceleration.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
I think the other PC is running 102, the release before 115 (112 was a beta version). It's not recommended to downgrade from 115. Be sure to test all the options mentioned in the other topic, including hardware acceleration.

sfhowes, as i said above, thunderbird 115 does not get the messages from the server, there is timeout error messages, so the emails are not available in the client.

I belive there is some problems in how 115 communicates with the network.

Your suggestion is related to how text is displayed, but for that the messages has to be available in the client. If i run 115 in troubleshoot mode the messages are loaded from the server and when i change to normal mode the messages can still be seen and read, which should proove that there is not problems with hardware acceleration or such.

For the sake of it i have tried to disable hardware acceleration and it makes no difference, the messages are still not loaded from the server, unless in troubleshoot mode.
creator: tomme2

content: When the focus is on the message list, the Home key selects the top message. If the message pane is in focus, Home moves the scrollbar to the top of the message.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, open ImapMail/imap.gmail.com. What is the size of the All Mail mbox file, the one with no extension? You might be able to recover a lot of space by unsubscribing All Mail, then closing TB and deleting All Mail and All Mail.msf.

Most users omit All Mail since it contains all messages in other folders.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Gmail
creator: sfhowes
